result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler David Goggin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tyler David Goggin is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Tyler David Goggin was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Count 2 in Deferred Judgment of Conviction.
Court dismisses Count 1.
Defendant to report to Probation today February 29, 2016 by 3:00 p.m.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

records.addlTxt: to Revoke DJOC filed by DA Michael Nieskes. To tfy for RMW review. eif

TO ALSO INCLUDE 19CF153 and 15CF364:
CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Tyler David Goggin appeared. Case called at 3:51 p.m. Court notes these matters are set for a pre trial conference. There is a resolution. ADA Minser recites agreement. In 19CF153,   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 Possession of Methamphetamine in 19CF153. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 Possession of Methamphetamine in 19CF153. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 19CF153. Sentencing arguments. Atty Harrelson requesting early discharge of probation if completes treatment court prior to the 2 years. ADA Minser moves to dismiss 15CF364. Court will not accept a dismissal but will consider an extension. ADA Minser requesting more time to review the paper file. Atty Harrelson is not appointed on that matter. Requesting all DE's rights are preserved. Court will set 15CF364 for an internal review in 30 days. ADA Minser  20 days to appeal. 

Crt orders:
- S/W 2 years probation. DE may apply for early discharge of probation upon successful completion of probation. 

- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections

- Successful completion of Treatment Court

- Court costs of $268.00. Court costs to be paid to DOC over the course of probation. 

- DNA Sample and Surcharge of $250.00

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 19CF153 & 15CF364:

Return on warrant on June 5, 2019 at 09:00 am.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Atty Joel Larimore appears for Alex Andrea   DF:  Tyler David Goggin appeared from jail. Case called at 4:40 p.m. Court reviews file. Pierce County preliminary hearing took place. ADA Minser in agreement to get defendant to treatment. Atty Larimore states that defendant and grandfather will stay at a hotel in MN to meet residency requirements and then will take to treatment.
Bail/bond hearing at 09-15-2015 04:30 pm

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea   DF:  Tyler David Goggin appeared from jail. Case called at 10:43 a.m. Atty Andrea requesting bond review or be granted a furlough to attend a treatment program. ADA McKinley objects as there is a pending preliminary hearing in Pierce County. If signature bond is granted though, grandfather should be present if providing transportation. Court will not grant a furlough but will entertain the bond modification. Would need a co-signer on the bond with grandfather and conditions would be that grandfather would need to transport defendant from jail to Salvation Army and if does not comply with treatment or absconds, needs to report back to St Croix County Jail immediately. Will not authorize until after 09-14-2015. Atty Andrea states defendant needs to have a 1 day residency in MN before entering treatment. Court will need to speak to grandfather before approving new bond.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 04:30 pm.
